shortDescription: Daily or regular running practice for cardiovascular health and mental clarity
scientificBenefits: Reduced risk of chronic diseases (heart disease, diabetes)
Enhanced mood through runner's high endorphins
Better stress management and mental health
Increased longevity and quality of life

researchCitations.study: Lee et al. (2014) - Journal of the American College of Cardiology
researchCitations.finding: Running 5-10 minutes daily reduces risk of cardiovascular mortality by 30%

researchCitations.study: Schuch et al. (2016) - Journal of Psychiatric Research
researchCitations.finding: Running reduces depressive symptoms with effect size comparable to psychotherapy

researchCitations.study: Chakravarty et al. (2008) - Archives of Internal Medicine
researchCitations.finding: Long-term runners show 39% lower mortality rate over 21-year period

commonBarriers: Weather excuses (too hot, too cold, raining)
Shin splints or knee pain from overtraining
progressionPlan: Week 1-2: Walk/run intervals (1 min run, 2 min walk) for 15-20 min. Week 3-4: Increase run intervals (2 min run, 1 min walk). Week 5-6: Continuous 20-minute runs. Week 7-8: Build to 30 minutes, experiment with pace/distance goals.
nooLifeFeatureHighlight: Running task with cinematic athlete visuals. Track distance, time, frequency. Pairs with other cardio habits. Contributes to Strength, Discipline, and Focus ratings. Visual heatmap shows consistency.
testimonial: "Couldn't run a mile without stopping. NooLife's progressive plan got me to 5K. Day 62, running is my meditation now." - Elena C.
ctaAngle: Build a sustainable running habit with Couch-to-5K style progression. Free 3-day trial.
